verses.kjv: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.
verses.web: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.
verses.ct: This is the prophecy about Babylon that Isaiah son of Amoz received.

verses.kjv: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
verses.web: Set up a banner on the bare mountain! Lift up your voice to them! Wave your hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
verses.ct: Raise a banner on the bare hilltop! Shout to the warriors! Wave them forward so they charge through the gates of the nobles.

verses.kjv: I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger, even them that rejoice in my highness.
verses.web: I have commanded my consecrated ones; yes, I have called my mighty men for my anger, even my proudly exulting ones.
verses.ct: "I have given orders to my chosen warriors. I have summoned my mighty fighters to carry out my anger — those who celebrate my triumph."

verses.kjv: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the LORD of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.
verses.web: The noise of a multitude is in the mountains, as of a great people; the noise of an uproar of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together! LORD of Armies is mustering the army for the battle.
verses.ct: Listen — the roar of a massive crowd echoes in the mountains, like a great nation assembling! It's the thunderous noise of kingdoms and nations gathering together. The LORD of hosts is marshaling an army for battle.

verses.kjv: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, even the LORD, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
verses.web: They come from a far country, from the uttermost part of heaven, even LORD, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
verses.ct: They are coming from a distant land, from the far edge of the heavens — the LORD himself, along with the weapons of his fury — to destroy the entire land.

verses.kjv: Howl ye; for the day of the LORD is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
verses.web: Wail, for LORD’s day is at hand! It will come as destruction from the Almighty.
verses.ct: Cry out in anguish, because the day of the LORD is close! It will come as devastation from the Almighty.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall all hands be faint, and every man’s heart shall melt:
verses.web: Therefore all hands will be feeble, and everyone’s heart will melt.
verses.ct: Because of this, every hand will go limp, and every heart will melt with fear.

verses.kjv: And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.
verses.web: They will be dismayed. Pangs and sorrows will seize them. They will be in pain like a woman in labor. They will look in amazement one at another. Their faces will be faces of flame.
verses.ct: Terror will grip them. Pain and agony will seize them like a woman in labor. They'll stare at each other in horror, their faces burning with panic.

verses.kjv: Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
verses.web: Behold, the day of LORD comes, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy its sinners out of it.
verses.ct: Look — the day of the LORD is coming, ruthless and full of wrath and fierce anger. He will turn the land into a wasteland and wipe out every sinner in it.

verses.kjv: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.
verses.web: For the stars of the sky and its constellations will not give their light. The sun will be darkened in its going out, and the moon will not cause its light to shine.
verses.ct: The stars and constellations in the heavens will stop shining. The sun will be dark when it rises, and the moon will give no light.

verses.kjv: And I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.
verses.web: I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity. I will cause the arrogance of the proud to cease, and will humble the arrogance of the terrible.
verses.ct: "I will punish the world for its evil and the wicked for their sin. I will crush the arrogance of the proud and bring down the ruthless from their high places."

verses.kjv: I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.
verses.web: I will make people more rare than fine gold, even a person than the pure gold of Ophir.
verses.ct: "I will make people scarcer than fine gold — rarer than the pure gold of Ophir."

verses.kjv: Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the LORD of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.web: Therefore I will make the heavens tremble, and the earth will be shaken out of its place in LORD of Armies’ wrath, and in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.ct: "So I will shake the heavens, and the earth will be jolted out of its place by the wrath of the LORD of hosts on the day of his fierce anger."

verses.kjv: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.
verses.web: It will happen that like a hunted gazelle, and like sheep that no one gathers, they will each turn to their own people, and will each flee to their own land.
verses.ct: Like a hunted gazelle or a sheep with no shepherd, everyone will scatter — each one fleeing to their own people, each one running back to their own land.

verses.kjv: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined unto them shall fall by the sword.
verses.web: Everyone who is found will be thrust through. Everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.
verses.ct: Anyone who is caught will be run through with a sword, and anyone who is captured will be cut down.

verses.kjv: Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.
verses.web: Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be ransacked, and their wives raped.
verses.ct: Their infants will be smashed to pieces before their eyes. Their homes will be looted, and their wives violated.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.
verses.web: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.
verses.ct: "Watch — I am stirring up the Medes against them. Silver means nothing to them, and gold holds no appeal."

verses.kjv: Their bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.
verses.web: Their bows will dash the young men in pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb. Their eyes will not spare children.
verses.ct: Their bows will cut down the young men. They will show no mercy to newborns, and they will not spare the children.

verses.kjv: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees’ excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
verses.web: Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride, will be like when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
verses.ct: Babylon — the jewel of kingdoms, the shining pride of the Chaldeans — will be demolished like Sodom and Gomorrah when God overthrew them.

verses.kjv: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.
verses.web: It will never be inhabited, neither will it be lived in from generation to generation. The Arabian will not pitch a tent there, neither will shepherds make their flocks lie down there.
verses.ct: No one will ever live there again. It will stand empty from generation to generation. No nomad will set up camp there, and no shepherd will rest their flocks in its ruins.

verses.kjv: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.
verses.web: But wild animals of the desert will lie there, and their houses will be full of jackals. Ostriches will dwell there, and wild goats will frolic there.
verses.ct: Instead, wild desert creatures will prowl through it. Jackals will fill its abandoned houses. Ostriches will nest there, and wild goats will leap among the rubble.

verses.kjv: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.
verses.web: Wolves will cry in their fortresses, and jackals in the pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, and her days will not be prolonged.
verses.ct: Wolves will howl in its crumbling fortresses, and jackals will cry out in its once-beautiful palaces. Babylon's time is almost here, and her days will not be extended.
